QuestionJSON.Question:
Rebel is designing a program for a company to streamline their recruitment and hiring process. The program will keep track of the number of applicants, the number of interviews conducted, and the number of hires made. Once these numbers reach certain thresholds, the program will print out a message. The code snippet currently looks as below:

How would Rebel correctly modify this program to print "Excellent Work, Team!" when (numInterviews >= 20) OR (numApplicants >= 100) AND (numHires >= 10)?

1action handleProcess(integer numApplicants, integer numInterviews, integer numHires)
2
if (numApplicants >= 50) and (numInterviews >= 10) and (numHires >= 5)
3
output "Meeting Targets "
4
else
5
output "More Efforts Needed"
6
end
7end
QuestionJSON.Answer1: Change the if-else to: if (numInterviews >= 20) or (numApplicants >= 100) and (numHires >= 10)
QuestionJSON.Answer2: Change the if-else to: if (numInterviews >= 20) and (numApplicants >= 100) or (numHires >= 10)
QuestionJSON.Answer3: Change the if-else to: if (numInterviews >= 20) or ((numApplicants >= 100) and (numHires >= 10))
QuestionJSON.Answer4: Change the if-else to: if ((numInterviews >= 20) or numApplicants >= 100) and (numHires >= 10)
QuestionJSON.Explanation: In Rebel's intended condition, two conditions must be met: (1) the number of interviews must be 20 or more, OR the company needs both (2) more than 100 applicants and at least 10 hires. To correctly capture this logic, the operands around the logical OR operator and the logical AND operator should be grouped using parentheses.
QuestionJSON.Code_Snippet:
1action handleProcess(integer numApplicants, integer numInterviews, integer numHires)
2
if (numApplicants >= 50) and (numInterviews >= 10) and (numHires >= 5)
3
output "Meeting Targets "
4
else
5
output "More Efforts Needed"
6
end
7end
